Author: By Monika Pronczuk

Title: Who Is James Cleverly, Britain’s New Home Secretary?
Subtitle: Cleverly is generally seen as less ideological and more of a team player than his predecessor in the Home Office, Suella Braverman.

Title: Speech and Antisemitism on Campus
Subtitle: Responses to articles about the tensions on college campuses. Also: Joe Manchin’s possible candidacy, and Jill Stein’s definite one; private art collections.

Author: By Charles Homans
Title: Rashida Tlaib, Censured by the House, Is Praised and Condemned at Home
Subtitle: The Democratic congresswoman from the Detroit area and the only Palestinian American in the House faces a complicated landscape in her district.

Author: By Kayla Guo
Title: Democratic Aides in Congress Break With Their Bosses on Israel-Hamas War
Subtitle: A wave of current and former staff members, mostly of a younger generation, are agitating for a cease-fire and speaking out against their bosses’ positions.

Author: By Nadav Gavrielov
Title: Hamas has held some Israeli hostages since long before Oct. 7.
Subtitle: Two Israeli citizens taken nearly a decade ago are believed to still be alive. Families are also fighting for the return of the remains of two soldiers killed in 2014.

Author: By Lisa Friedman
Title: Biden calls for ‘less intrusive action’ around Gaza’s battered hospitals.

Author: By Alissa J. Rubin
Title: Iran’s proxies escalate attacks on U.S. troops in Iraq and Syria.

Author: By Hiba Yazbek, Ameera Harouda and Thomas Fuller
Title: Death and Despair at Gaza Hospital as Fighting Reaches Its Doors
Subtitle: “I’m watching patients die in front of my eyes,” one doctor at a besieged hospital said, “and I can’t provide them the slightest bit of help.” Israel said its forces were targeting Hamas fighters.

Author: By Michael Crowley and Edward Wong
Title: State Department employees send Blinken ‘dissent’ cables over Gaza policy.
Subtitle: The messages urge the Biden administration to press Israel for a cease-fire, according to U.S. officials. Two were said to have been sent in the first week of the war.

Author: By Farnaz Fassihi
Title: U.N. says that without fuel it can no longer distribute humanitarian aid.
Subtitle: The lack of fuel, used to operate the fork lifts that unload the goods and the trucks that deliver them, is imperiling the only lifeline for the 2.2 million people in the coastal enclave.

Author: By Carl Hulse and Catie Edmondson
Title: Democrats Signal Openness to Plan to Avert Shutdown as Republicans Balk
Subtitle: The House could take up the proposal as early as Tuesday. With growing opposition from House Republicans, it will need Democrats’ backing.

Author: By Ephrat Livni
Title: Hamas Releases Video of Hostage Noa Marciano, Saying She Was Killed in Gaza Bombardments
Subtitle: The Israeli military released a statement appearing to confirm the authenticity of the video, which it condemned as “psychological terrorism.”

Author: By Alissa J. Rubin
Title: New Video Suggests Israeli-Russian Academic Kidnapped in Iraq Is Alive
Subtitle: Elizabeth Tsurkov, who is believed to be held by a pro-Iranian Shiite militia, was shown in an unauthenticated video speaking about the Israeli hostages held in Gaza.

Author: By Natasha Frost
Title: Tuesday Briefing
Subtitle: Calls to protect hospitals in Gaza.

Author: By Dalia Hatuqa
Title: This War Did Not Start a Month Ago
Subtitle: For Palestinians, systematic violence is nothing new. It dates back to the nakba.

Author: By Thomas L. Friedman
Title: The Most Revealing Moment From My Trip to Israel
Subtitle: It is time for a Biden peace plan.

Author: By Maria Abi-Habib, Michael Crowley and Edward Wong
Title: More Than 500 U.S. Officials Sign Letter Protesting Biden’s Israel Policy
Subtitle: The signers, representing some 40 government agencies, reflect growing internal dissent over the administration’s support of Israel’s military campaign in Gaza.

Author: By Ben Hubbard
Title: The Man Who Blazed a Trail for Dictatorship in the Middle East
Subtitle: In “We Are Your Soldiers,” Alex Rowell shows how the Egyptian president Gamal Abdel Nasser inspired and fostered autocracy among his Arab neighbors in the 20th century and beyond.

Author: By Miriam Jordan
Title: Hard Hit by Loss of Thai and Palestinian Workers, Israeli Farmers Call for Volunteers
Subtitle: After the Oct. 7 terror attack, Israel banned Gazan farm workers, and many other foreign laborers returned to their home countries.

Author: By Osita Nwanevu
Title: Why Tim Scott Couldn’t Go the Distance
Subtitle: The South Carolina senator failed to excite Republican voters with his racial optimism.

Author: By Campbell Robertson, Michael Wines and Zach Montague
Title: Jewish Groups Rally for Israel on National Mall
Subtitle: The rally was a response to large protests across the United States and the world denouncing the Israeli military campaign in Gaza.

Author: By Michael Barbaro, Mary Wilson, Asthaa Chaturvedi, Rob Szypko, Paige Cowett, Devon Taylor, Dan Powell, Rowan Niemisto, Pat McCusker and Alyssa Moxley
Title: Hamas’s Bloody Arithmetic
Subtitle: The group’s leaders say they believe a permanent state of war is the only way to revive the Palestinian cause.

Author: By New York Times Audio
Title: Growing Dissent Against Biden’s Israel Policy, and More
Subtitle: Plus, an ethics code for the Supreme Court and a new report on climate change.

Author: By David Leonhardt
Title: The Debate Over Al-Shifa
Subtitle: The battle over the hospital highlights the lack of simple answers in Gaza.

Author: By Nadav Gavrielov
Title: Peace Activist Thought to Be a Hostage in Gaza Is Confirmed Dead
Subtitle: Vivian Silver, 74, a Canadian Israeli, was believed to have been abducted on Oct. 7 but was killed in the initial attacks that day, her son said.

Author: By Aaron Boxerman, Daniel Victor, Ronen Bergman and Talya Minsberg
Title: Babies are among the thousands inside Al-Shifa as Israeli troops close in.

Author: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Ravi Mattu, Bernhard Warner, Sarah Kessler, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch, Ephrat Livni and Benjamin Weiser
Title: A High-Stakes Inflation Report for Washington and Wall Street
Subtitle: The latest Consumer Price Index report, due out on Tuesday, is expected to show that progress in bringing down inflation is slowing.

Author: By Anat Schwartz
Title: Israeli authorities show more evidence of Hamas atrocities.

Author: By Catie Edmondson
Title: House Passes Johnson’s Plan to Avert Shutdown in Bipartisan Vote
Subtitle: With many Republicans refusing to back more government spending, Democrats supplied the bulk of the votes for the speaker’s bill to extend federal funding through early 2024.

Title: Israel Shows Videos of Gaza Hospital Basement It Says Was Used by Hamas
Subtitle: Israel released two videos from inside Gaza’s main children’s hospital that showed weapons and explosives. Gazan health officials denied the hospital was used for military purposes.

Author: By Adam Sella
Title: Families of Hostages Start a March From Tel Aviv to Jerusalem
Subtitle: About 100 people plan to march to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office to pressure him to do whatever it takes to bring their loved ones home, setting up camp each night along the way.

Author: By Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt
Title: Recent U.S. strikes on Iran-linked sites in Syria killed at least six people, a U.S. official says.

Author: By Michael M. Grynbaum and Katie Robertson
Title: Harsh Visuals of War Leave Newsrooms Facing Tough Choices
Subtitle: Digital disinformation and restrictions on photojournalists have complicated decision-making about the visual chronicle of the Israel-Hamas war.

Author: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Hiba Yazbek
Title: Bodies are being buried in a mass grave at Gaza City’s largest hospital, health officials say.

Author: By Elizabeth A. Harris and Alexandra Alter
Title: Israel-Hamas War Sows Disruption at the National Book Awards
Subtitle: Two sponsors have withdrawn from the event, planned for Wednesday, after learning that some of the authors involved are planning to make a political statement about the conflict.

Author: By Campbell Robertson, Michael Wines and Zach Montague
Title: American Jews rally in Washington to support Israel and oppose antisemitism.

Author: By Lisa Friedman
Title: Biden’s message to hostages’ families: ‘Hang in there. We’re coming.’
Subtitle: The United States is actively engaged in indirect talks involving Israel, Hamas and Qatar to secure their release.

Author: By Sharon LaFraniere and Erica L. Green
Title: Inside the Desperate Effort to Evacuate Young Cancer Patients From Gaza
Subtitle: A mission to rescue cancer-stricken children from the violence in Gaza has involved multiple countries and last-minute connections in the chaos of war.

Title: Evidence Points to Israeli Shells in Strikes on Gaza’s Largest Hospital
Subtitle: Israel said Palestinian militants had misfired projectiles, but an analysis of photos and videos of Friday’s strikes shows that some of the munitions were likely fired by Israeli forces.

Author: By Michael D. Shear
Title: U.S. Says Hamas Operates Out of Gaza Hospitals, Endorsing Israel’s Allegations
Subtitle: John Kirby, a spokesman for the National Security Council, said that intelligence from U.S.-generated sources supported Israel’s claim that Hamas has tunnels under Al-Shifa and other hospitals.

Author: By Talya Minsberg and Aaron Boxerman
Title: Israel says it has taken control of northern Gaza above ground, but that Hamas fighters remain in tunnels.

Author: By Justin Porter
Title: Wednesday Briefing: Updates on Gaza’s Main Hospital
Subtitle: Plus a treasure trove of ancient maps.

Title: Satellite images show Israeli tanks 600 feet from Al-Shifa Hospital
Subtitle: Satellite images show that Israeli forces are stationed one block from Al-Shifa, the biggest hospital in Gaza City, an area that has been the site of intensified fighting in recent days.

Author: By Sarah Maslin Nir
Title: Hundreds Fly From Israel to Pray for Hostages at the Rebbe’s Grave in Queens

Author: By Ben Hubbard
Title: With 102 Workers Killed, U.N. Agency in Gaza Struggles to Provide Aid

Title: The U.N. highlights the harrowing conditions in Gaza for pregnant women.

Author: By Matthew Cullen
Title: The House Passed a Plan to Avert a Shutdown
Subtitle: Also, airlines are suddenly offering deals. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

Author: By Matthew Rosenberg, Nadav Gavrielov and Michael Levenson
Title: Israel Says Military Has Entered Gazan Hospital Grounds to Root Out Hamas
Subtitle: The operation at the main hospital complex in Gaza came after Israel released videos showing what it said were weapons inside a children’s hospital in the enclave.

Author: By Bret Stephens
Title: The Hate That Doesn’t Know Its Own Name
Subtitle: “You can be a Ph.D. and an S.O.B. at the same time,” says the U.S. envoy for combating antisemitism.

Author: By James C. McKinley Jr. and Victoria Kim
Title: Israel announced a ‘precise and targeted operation’ at Al-Shifa.

Author: By Carl Hulse

Subtitle: Speaker Mike Johnson chose avoiding a shutdown over a fiscal confrontation that Representative Mike Johnson might have welcomed.

Title: U.S. and China Agree to Displace Fossil Fuels by Ramping Up Renewables
Subtitle: The climate agreement between the two countries is seen as a bright spot as President Biden prepares to meet President Xi Jinping.

Title: Wednesday Briefing
Subtitle: An Israeli raid on Al-Shifa Hospital.

Title: U.K. Can’t Deport Asylum Seekers to Rwanda, Supreme Court Rules
Subtitle: Dealing a major blow to the governing Conservative Party, Britain’s highest court said the East African country was not a safe place for refugees.

Title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Michael Podhorzer
Subtitle: The Nov. 14, 2023, episode of “The Ezra Klein Show.”

Author: By Samar Abu Elouf
Title: The Patient

Subtitle: Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida and Nikki Haley, the former governor of South Carolina, have attacked each other with misleading claims on dealings with Chinese companies, energy and refugees.

Title: ‘Erase Gaza’: War Unleashes Incendiary Rhetoric in Israel

Title: News Organizations Should Publish This Photo

Subtitle: Al-Shifa hospital has become emblematic of Israel’s campaign to wrest control of Gaza from Hamas.

Title: The Hostages Are Not a Diversion From This War. They’re at the Heart of It.

Title: Israeli Troops Enter Gaza Hospital, and More
Subtitle: Plus, Biden and Xi Jinping prepare to meet and the House passes a plan to avoid a shutdown.

Title: The Cost of Streaming

Author: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg
Title: Leaders from the U.N., Turkey and Jordan condemn Israel’s raid of Al-Shifa.

Author: By Soumya Karlamangla

Subtitle: A conversation with Sarah Kessler, a reporter who wrote about how work-from-home norms may make it harder for women to get ahead.

Title: Palestinian and Israeli Teens Swam in the Same Pool. Then Came Oct. 7.

Title: What I’m Reading

Title: Antisemitic and Anti-Muslim Hate Speech Surges Across the Internet
Subtitle: Fueled by the conflict between Israel and Gaza and stoked by extremists, hate speech has spiked on social media platforms such as X, Facebook and Instagram, researchers said.

Author: By Nada Rashwan, Hiba Yazbek and Aaron Boxerman
Title: The U.N. agency that aids Palestinians says it has received a small amount of fuel in Gaza.

Title: A White House spokesman denies that the U.S. had advance warning of Israel’s raid of Al-Shifa Hospital.

Author: By Ronen Bergman and Matthew Rosenberg
Title: Israel and Hamas Appear to Be Near Hostage Deal, Officials Say

Author: By Vivian Wang
Title: Xi goes into talks in a shakier political position than a year ago.

Title: F.B.I. Ramps Up Investigations of Hamas

Author: By Charles M. Blow
Title: The Question of Anti-Zionism and Antisemitism
Subtitle: It is here, in the dispute over definitions, that things begin to break down.

Subtitle: A raid of a hospital that Israel asserts is a base for Hamas is shaping up as a watershed moment in a conflict that has put the Mideast on edge.

Title: Thursday Briefing: The Biden-Xi Meeting

Author: By Edward Wong
Title: Biden Says a ‘Real’ Palestinian State Must Come After War
Subtitle: President Biden emphasized that the Israeli-Palestinian conflict will not end without a two-state solution.

Author: By Natasha Frost
Title: Thursday Briefing
Subtitle: Israel’s raid of Gaza’s main hospital.

Title: U.N. Security Council Calls for Dayslong Humanitarian Pauses in Gaza
Subtitle: After weeks of division, the Council adopted a resolution that stopped short of calling for a cease-fire.

Title: In Britain, Reality Is Cleaving in Two

Subtitle: The House agreed to keep the government open for a few weeks. But don’t expect the good sense to last long.

Title: Israel’s Opposition Leader Says Netanyahu ‘Must Go Now’

Subtitle: A day after capturing Al-Shifa hospital, the Israeli Army had yet to produce compelling evidence of its dual use. The military said the search would take time.

Title: What the Biden-Xi Talks Accomplished (and Didn't)

Author: By Matthew Mpoke Bigg

Title: How International Law Views Military Action at a Hospital

Title: 2 Israeli Hostages’ Bodies Were Recovered Near Al-Shifa Hospital, Army Says

Title: Protesters Demanding Gaza Cease-Fire Shut Down Bay Bridge

Author: By Carl Hulse and Catie Edmondson

Subtitle: Lawmakers bought time for talks, but heading off another shutdown threat early next year will be difficult. And a separate funding measure for Israel, Ukraine and the border remains unaddressed.

Title: Talks on Surveillance Law Simmer as Its Expiration Date Looms
Subtitle: If congressional inaction lets Section 702 lapse on New Year’s Eve, officials believe the program could lawfully operate into April.

Title: Friday Briefing: Israel Continues to Search Al-Shifa

Title: Israeli Troops Scoured a Gaza Hospital for Signs of Hamas

Title: There Should Be More Public Pressure on Hamas

Author: By David Brooks
Title: Universities Are Failing at Inclusion

Author: By Eileen Sullivan, Edward Wong and Patrick Kingsley
Title: Israel is blocking Palestinian Americans from entering the West Bank.

Author: By Farnaz Fassihi
Title: The U.N. warns that all 2.2 million people in Gaza are at risk of starvation.

Title: This Is What’s Become of the House

Title: Israel says it will allow some fuel into Gaza for the U.N. and to power water and sewage plants.

Title: U.S. officials insist Hamas was operating under Al-Shifa Hospital, despite a lack of public documentation.

Title: The C.I.A. director and the Israeli intelligence chief met with Qatari officials to discuss a possible Hamas hostage deal.

Title: Al-Shifa Hospital is increasingly a flashpoint in the war.

Subtitle: The tentative agreement would end the longest movie and television strike in SAG-AFTRA’s 90-year history.

Title: Biden calls for ‘less intrusive action’ around Gaza’s battered hospitals.

Subtitle: The Israeli military released a statement appearing to confirm the authenticity of the video, which it condemned as “psychological terrorism.”

Subtitle: Christopher A. Wray, whose agency has worked with Israeli authorities to pursue atrocities committed by Hamas, has made his first visit to Israel since the war began, the bureau disclosed.

Subtitle: Also, a coalition forms in Pakistan and motorbikes pile high in Vietnam.

Author: By Johnatan Reiss and Gaya Gupta

Subtitle: Some family members of the hostages still in Gaza criticized any such decision and protested outside the homes of Israeli officials.

Title: Biden Shields Palestinians in the U.S. From Deportation
Subtitle: The president, who is facing mounting criticism over U.S. support for Israel, used an authority that exempts people from deportation if their homeland is in crisis.

Subtitle: A congressman’s cryptic statement about new intelligence set Washington abuzz and infuriated White House officials.

Subtitle: Alliances that were once seen as the bulwark of the Cold War are now viewed as an outdated albatross by a significant segment of the American public.

Title: Thursday Briefing
Subtitle: Russian advances on a space-based nuclear weapon.

Author: By Dana Goldstein
Title: California’s Push for Ethnic Studies Runs Into the Israel-Hamas War
Subtitle: The state’s high school students will be required to take the subject, but some object to how the discipline addresses the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

Title: Do Not Invite Donald Trump or Joe Biden on This Date

Title: Israel says it sent special forces into the largest hospital in southern Gaza.

Title: He Lost a Son, Then Chronicled Life in a Gaza Hospital

Subtitle: Plus, Russian advances on space-based nuclear weapon.

Title: In New York on Oct. 7, Honoring the Dead and Calling for an End to War
Subtitle: In the city, which is home both to the largest Jewish population outside Israel and to thousands of Palestinians, some gathered in protest and others in solemn remembrance.

Author: By Celestine Bohlen
Title: Seeking the Road to Peace in the Middle East
Subtitle: Panelists at the Athens Democracy Forum discussed the widening conflict and the challenge of getting the warring parties to a consensus.

Author: By Farah Nayeri
Title: Athens Democracy Forum: Where Is Global Politics Headed?
Subtitle: Voters have more opportunities than ever in 2024 to shape history in their countries, but war, technology and other forces pose a powerful threat, experts said.

Author: By Reid J. Epstein and Katie Rogers
Title: 7 Takeaways From Harris’s Interview on ‘60 Minutes’
Subtitle: Pressed repeatedly, Kamala Harris stayed focused on the points she wanted to make. She also spoke about owning a Glock, and Tim Walz revealed she had told him to be a “little more careful” speaking.

Author: By Michael Gold
Title: Trump Sees Antisemitism in Only One Direction: On the Left
Subtitle: At an event marking the anniversary of Hamas’s Oct. 7 attack on Israel, Donald Trump claimed that antisemitism existed within the Democratic Party but not the Republican Party.
